metadata.titel_preek: Jezus Zitten aan de Rechterhand van God

kernfrasen: wij maken een stapje naar zondag 19

dominante_domeinen.conceptuele_metafoor: GOD IS A PARENT / BELIEVERS ARE CHILDREN
SIN IS DEBT / SALVATION IS PAYMENT

metafoor_inventaris.metafoor_expressie: Pietje's mama die zat nooit, behalve als het klaar was.

mapping_structuur.doel_element: Christ sitting at God's right hand

cognitieve_implicaties: If Christ is sitting, there is no more work for the believer to do.
theologische_implicaties: The sufficiency of the one-time sacrifice (Hebrews 10).
ethische_implicaties: Ceasing from self-justification; resting in grace.

metafoor_inventaris.vitaliteit_toelichting: The preacher revitalizes the 'dead' theological term 'sitting' by mapping it to the vivid, relatable image of an overworked mother.

coherentie_analyse.coherentie_verklaring: The preacher uses the domestic 'sitting' metaphor to establish peace, then shifts to the military 'D-Day' metaphor to explain remaining suffering. The transition is managed by the distinction between 'having authority' and 'receiving authority'.

incoherentie_punten.conflict_beschrijving: The shift from the domestic rest of the mother to the violent imagery of the Lion and D-Day creates a cognitive tension between safety and combat.
incoherentie_punten.entailment_conflict: Resting entails lack of movement; warfare entails aggressive action.

succesvolle_blending.blending_strategie: The preacher blends the power of the Lion with the 'human heart' of the Lamb to ensure the military power is perceived as loving.

sterktes.beschrijving: Re-activating the physical posture of 'sitting' to explain the finality of the atonement.
sterktes.voorbeeld: U kunt het erbij laten zitten, omdat de Heer Jezus is gaan zitten.

risicos.beschrijving: Heavy use of debt/payment metaphors might reduce the relationship with God to a ledger.
risicos.voorbeeld: U bent in de positie terecht gekomen waarin er nooit meer wat af te betalen valt.
risicos.potentiele_impact: Hearers might view grace as a financial transaction rather than a personal union.

text_world_analyse.primaire_wereld: A busy household with 'Pietje' and his mother.

versterkte_schemas.hoe_versterkt: Using the D-Day/V-Day analogy to explain the 'already/not yet' of the Kingdom.

verstoorde_schemas.verstoring_strategie: Using the image of the messy child eating at the table.
verstoorde_schemas.vervangend_schema: God as a delighted Father who ignores the 'crumbs' because of the relationship.

schema_analyse.liturgische_schema_aansluiting: Strongly aligns with the Heidelberg Catechism's structure of 'Comfort'.

aanbevelingen.metafoor_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is metaphorically rich, moving from domestic peace to economic relief to military victory. It successfully grounds abstract Christology in embodied experiences (sitting, eating, fighting).

revitalisatie_suggesties.voorbeeld: Describe the signet ring of Joseph as the 'executive power' of Jesus.

coherentie_verbeteringen.incoherentie: The transition from the 'resting mother' to the 'warrior king'.
coherentie_verbeteringen.resolutie_strategie: Use the 'Sabbath' concept as a bridge—the King fights to secure the rest.

entailment_checks.problematisch_entailment: God only loves us because the bill is paid.
entailment_checks.aanbeveling: Emphasize that the Father *sent* the Son because He already loved us (Source of the payment).

alternatieve_domeinen.rationale: To explain the 'Cornerstone' aspect of the Sessio Christi.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in using CMT to make the Heidelberg Catechism accessible to both children and adults.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_esthetiek: CMT focuses on how the 'sitting' metaphor changes the hearer's logic of salvation, not just the beauty of the mother story.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_kolb: CMT looks at the mapping of domains rather than the learning cycle of experience/reflection.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_CMT: Reveals that the preacher uses 'Verticality' (Right hand/High) to establish authority and 'Container' (In the bank/In Christ) to establish security.

appendices.notities: The preacher uses 'sitting' as a primary cognitive anchor for the entire first half of the sermon.
